intro: Podalyria mutabilis, commonly known as the variable podalyria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive, often showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate regions and has a sprawling, herbaceous growth habit. Its leaves are trifoliate, composed of three small, oval-shaped leaflets. The flowers, which can range in color from white to pink, are borne in clusters and attract various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
